title: Simple Modern Calculator
description: A modern calculator app I built in just one day using Python and Tkinter. What started as a fun mini-challenge turned into a clean, functional tool with support for basic operations, trigonometric functions, and more. I wanted to test how much I could build in a short time, focusing on usability and simple design. Tkinter was perfect for fast development, and I used the project to sharpen both my UI and logic-building skills.
challenge: Building everything from scratch with no prior GUI calculator experience — and finishing it all in a day.
solution: Used my free evening to sketch a quick UI idea, researched some minimalist calculator designs, and coded the core features one at a time.
impact: This small project helped boost my confidence in Python GUI development and proved that focused effort — even on a random day — can lead to something useful and presentable.

title: Dark Mode To-Do List
description: A modern, minimalist To-Do List application built using Python and Tkinter. Designed in a sleek dark theme, this app helps users manage daily tasks efficiently. Users can add, edit, complete, and delete tasks with intuitive buttons, and even clear all tasks with a single click. Each task entry is interactive, and the layout is responsive to user actions. This was a solo project built in a day, showcasing clean UI structuring and dynamic widget handling using only Python.
challenge: Creating an intuitive and responsive task management UI using only basic Tkinter without third-party libraries.
solution: Used custom dialog boxes for input/editing, applied consistent dark theme colors, and structured task components using reusable frames and widgets.
impact: The app became a fun and practical tool for organizing daily goals. Its UI-focused design shows what can be achieved with core Python in just one day.
